content: I'd like to get push notifications working on my self-hosted server. I followed the instructions here and sent an email to support. What's the usual turnaround time for setting that up? I'm running zulip 1.6; does that mean IOS is not supported?

Would have been faster, but I need to be in one of like 3 specific locations to access the bouncer :).
I think if you deploy from master right now, iOS should work, though 1.7 (with iOS support) should be released within a couple of weeks.

I can't really test android at the moment because all my team members are gone for the day. I re-read the documentation and the turnaround time is listed as 24 hours.. sorry for being so impatient, lol

I'm running the docker version and have injected an environment variable SETTING_PUSH_NOTIFICATION_BOUNCER_URL=https://push.zulipchat.com. I assume that works because that's the same prefix as the other zulip-specific vars in /etc/zulip/settings.py

maybe try setting both? (that and PUSH_NOTIFICATION_BOUNCER_URL).
As a warning, I don't know if there is a well-supported docker version for Zulip yet.
@Alexander Trost do you happen to know whether that option is supported by the Docker setup?
Yes that should work. All Zulip settings are prefixed by SETTING_ for configuration.

Confirmed, using the SETTING_ prefix for the environment-injected variables in docker worked: SETTING_PUSH_NOTIFICATION_BOUNCER_URL. I think I started receiving push notifications today but I can't be sure. I can't find any server logs to prove it.. Is there a db query or server url I can ping to verify android GCM push notifications are working on v1.6?
The "mobile push notifications always (even when I'm online) setting at https://chat.zulip.org/#settings/notifications is convenient for testing.
The answer to your actual question will have to wait for someone more knowledgable, though :)

Thanks for the tip. I did see that setting in user settings and it's helpfully in the documentation as well as a testing tip. The problem is I'm seeing notifications show up on my cell phone top notifications area but I do not know if they are generated by the app or if they are actual "push" notifications?
Looks like @Rishi Gupta did me a solid and got me some real confirmation these are truly push notifications.
@Rishi Gupta maybe we should clarify the docs to say that you can tell if its working if notifications appear in the phone notifications area?
I think we don't currently spell that out.
